intro: Freziera florida, commonly known as the Florida freziera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Freziera florida is often found in moist, wooded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
